refnamediv.refpurpose: multiplatformal/distribution system environments dumping and comparation

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Multiplatformal/distribution system environments dumping and comparation. There is also windows version available.

para.screen: help ................... shows help show ................... shows files in package (s) dump ................... creates pkgversions.xml (d) backup ................. dumps state with timestamp format compare-report ......... creates pkgversions.xml dump, compares it with base.xml and creates html report (c) compare-installed-pkgs . prints list of added packages from base state compare-removed-pkgs ... prints list of removed packages from base state check .................. checks system parameters given by commandline comma separated array (ch)

all or empty = default default ---------------------------------------------------- pkglist ...... installed package list (s,d,ch) * pkgver ....... installed package versions (s,d) pkgver gcc ... package versions of one package (s,d) * env .......... environment variables according file (s,d) * hw ........... HW info (s,d) * sys .......... system info (s,d) pkgdescr ..... packages with description (d) * pkgcount ..... number of installed packages (s)

listitem.para: Generates report with equal and current unique (additional) packages (c).
Writes output to different file (c). (default report.html)
Changes main input/output xmlfile name (default pkgversions.xml) (s,d,c)
Changes output xmlfile name fro pkgdescr (default pkgdescriptions.xml) (d)
Comparation returns 1 if there are some packages missing (c).

refsect1.title: EXAMPLES
refsect1.screen:
example1: generate default (short) comparation report: xmlenv compare -b example/base.xml -o example/result-short.html
example2: generate full comparation report: xmlenv compare -v -b example/base.xml -o example/result-full.html --full -v .............. script verbose output -b <xml-file> ... dumped base xml file which we compare to -r <html-file> .. save report to somewhere else --full .......... show in report 1.equal and 2.current unique(additional) packages
example3: dump with comment xmlenv dump -c "before installing dev env"
example4: check installed packages ./xmlenv check pkglist gcc,gdb .. returns 0 ./xmlenv check pkglist gcc,gdb,not-existing .. returns 1
example5: remote backup dumping ssh user@host 'bash /dev/stdin backup' < /usr/bin/xmlenv scp -r user@host:.xmlenv .
example6: external comparation ./xmlenv compare -b ./first.xml -x ./second.xml -dd -or ./my-report.html
example7: state saving (to ~/.xmlenv/) xmlenv backup -m "installed base image"
example8: package count from files xmlenv show pkgcount -x pkgversions.xml
